properties.description: AAD (Azure Active Directory) data connector properties.

dataTypes.description: The available data types for the connector.

tenantId.description: The tenant id to connect to, and get the data from.

properties.description: AATP (Azure Advanced Threat Protection) data connector properties.

dataTypes.description: The available data types for the connector.

tenantId.description: The tenant id to connect to, and get the data from.

triggerUri.description: Logic App Callback URL for this specific workflow.

alertDescriptionFormat.description: the format containing columns name(s) to override the alert description

alertDisplayNameFormat.description: the format containing columns name(s) to override the alert name

alertDynamicProperties.description: List of additional dynamic properties to override

alertSeverityColumnName.description: the column name to take the alert severity from

alertTacticsColumnName.description: the column name to take the alert tactics from

value.description: the column name to use to override this property

kind.description: The kind of security ML Analytics Settings

properties.description: Anomaly Security ML Analytics Settings properties

anomalySettingsVersion.description: The anomaly settings version of the Anomaly security ml analytics settings that dictates whether job version gets updated or not.

anomalyVersion.description: The anomaly version of the AnomalySecurityMLAnalyticsSettings.

customizableObservations.description: The customizable observations of the AnomalySecurityMLAnalyticsSettings.

displayName.description: The display name for settings created by this SecurityMLAnalyticsSettings.

enabled.description: Determines whether this settings is enabled or disabled.

frequency.description: The frequency that this SecurityMLAnalyticsSettings will be run.

isDefaultSettings.description: Determines whether this anomaly security ml analytics settings is a default settings

requiredDataConnectors.description: The required data sources for this SecurityMLAnalyticsSettings

apiKey.description: API Key for the user secret key credential

isApiKeyInPostPayload.description: Flag to indicate if API key is set in HTTP POST payload

properties.description: ASC (Azure Security Center) data connector properties.

dataTypes.description: The available data types for the connector.

subscriptionId.description: The subscription id to connect to, and get the data from.

actionConfiguration.description: Describes an automation rule action to add a task to an incident.

actionType.description: The type of the automation rule action.
The type of the automation rule action.

actions.description: The actions to execute when the automation rule is triggered.

displayName.description: The display name of the automation rule.

order.description: The order of execution of the automation rule.

arrayConditionType.description: Describes an array condition evaluation type.

arrayType.description: Describes an array condition evaluated array type.

propertyName.description: The property to evaluate in an automation rule property condition.

actionType.description: The type of the automation rule action.

conditions.description: The conditions to evaluate to determine if the automation rule should be triggered on a given object.

expirationTimeUtc.description: Determines when the automation rule should automatically expire and be disabled.

isEnabled.description: Determines whether the automation rule is enabled or disabled.

externalId.description: AWS STS assume role external ID. This is used to prevent the confused deputy problem: 'https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/confused-deputy.html'

properties.description: Amazon Web Services CloudTrail data connector properties.

state.description: Describe whether this data type connection is enabled or not.

awsRoleArn.description: The Aws Role Arn (with CloudTrailReadOnly policy) that is used to access the Aws account.

dataTypes.description: The available data types for the connector.

created.description: The time the bookmark was created

createdBy.description: Describes a user that created the bookmark

displayName.description: The display name of the bookmark

incidentInfo.description: Describes an incident that relates to bookmark

labels.description: List of labels relevant to this bookmark

queryEndTime.description: The end time for the query

queryResult.description: The query result of the bookmark.

queryStartTime.description: The start time for the query

updated.description: The last time the bookmark was updated

updatedBy.description: Describes a user that updated the bookmark

conditionProperties.description: Describes an automation rule condition with boolean operators.

convertChildPropertiesToArray.description: The value indicating whether the response isn't an array of events / logs.  By setting this flag to true it means the remote server will response with an object which each property has as a value an array of events / logs.

csvDelimiter.description: The csv delimiter, in case the response format is CSV.

csvEscape.description: The character used to escape characters in CSV.

eventsJsonPaths.description: The json paths, '$' char is the json root.

format.description: The response format. possible values are json,csv,xml

hasCsvBoundary.description: The value indicating whether the response has CSV boundary in case the response in CSV format.

hasCsvHeader.description: The value indicating whether the response has headers in case the response in CSV format.

isGzipCompressed.description: The value indicating whether the remote server support Gzip and we should expect Gzip response.

successStatusJsonPath.description: The value where the status message/code should appear in the response.

objectId.description: The object id of the client.

userPrincipalName.description: The user principal name of the client.

type.description: Gets or sets the type of connectivity.

value.description: Gets or sets the queries for checking connectivity.

lastDataReceivedQuery.description: Gets or sets the query to indicate when relevant data was last received in the workspace.

name.description: Gets or sets the name of the data type to show in the graph.

isPreview.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the connector is preview.

status.description: The exposure status of the connector to the customers. Available values are 0-4 (0=None, 1=Available, 2=FeatureFlag, 3=Internal).

customs.description: Gets or sets the customs permissions required for the user to create connections.

licenses.description: Gets or sets the required licenses for the user to create connections.

resourceProvider.description: Gets or sets the resource provider permissions required for the user to create connections.

tenant.description: Gets or sets the required tenant permissions for the connector.

permissionsDisplayText.description: Gets or sets the permissions description text.

provider.description: Gets or sets the provider name.

providerDisplayName.description: Gets or sets the permissions provider display name.

requiredPermissions.description:
Required permissions for the connector resource provider that define in ResourceProviders.
For more information about the permissions see <see href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/role-based-access-control/role-definitions#actions-format">here</see>.

scope.description: The scope on which the user should have permissions, in order to be able to create connections.

templateSpecName.description: Gets or sets the template name. The template includes ARM templates that can be created by the connector, usually it will be the dataConnectors ARM templates.

templateSpecVersion.description: Gets or sets the template version.

properties.description: Customizable properties.

connectionsConfig.description: The UiConfig for 'Customizable' connector definition kind.

connectorUiConfig.description: The UiConfig for 'Customizable' connector definition kind.

createdTimeUtc.description: Gets or sets the connector definition created date in UTC format.

lastModifiedUtc.description: Gets or sets the connector definition last modified date in UTC format.

availability.description: The exposure status of the connector to the customers.

connectivityCriteria.description: Gets or sets the way the connector checks whether the connector is connected.

dataTypes.description: Gets or sets the data types to check for last data received.

descriptionMarkdown.description: Gets or sets the connector description in markdown format.

graphQueries.description: Gets or sets the graph queries to show the current data volume over time.

id.description: Gets or sets custom connector id. optional field.

instructionSteps.description: Gets or sets the instruction steps to enable the connector.

isConnectivityCriteriasMatchSome.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use 'OR'(SOME) or 'AND' between ConnectivityCriteria items.

logo.description:
Gets or sets the connector logo to be used when displaying the connector within Azure Sentinel's connector's gallery.
The logo value should be in SVG format.

permissions.description: The required Permissions for the connector.

publisher.description: Gets or sets the connector publisher name.

title.description: Gets or sets the connector blade title.

description.description: Gets or sets the custom permissions description.

name.description: Gets or sets the custom permissions name.

state.description: Describe whether this data type connection is enabled or not.

dataCollectionEndpoint.description: Represents the data collection ingestion endpoint in log analytics.

dataCollectionRuleImmutableId.description: The data collection rule immutable id, the rule defines the transformation and data destination.

streamName.description: The stream we are sending the data to.

entityType.description: The V3 type of the mapped entity

fieldMappings.description: array of field mappings for the given entity mapping

columnName.description: the column name to be mapped to the identifier

identifier.description: the V3 identifier of the entity

properties.description: Fusion alert rule properties

alertRuleTemplateName.description: The Name of the alert rule template used to create this rule.

enabled.description: Determines whether this alert rule is enabled or disabled.

credentialsConfig.description: Credentials for service bus namespace, keyvault uri for access key

storageAccountCredentialsConfig.description: Credentials for storage account, keyvault uri for access key

baseQuery.description:
Gets or sets the base query for the graph.
The base query is wrapped by Sentinel UI infra with a KQL query, that measures the volume over time.

legend.description: Gets or sets the legend for the graph.

metricName.description: Gets or sets the metric name that the query is checking. For example: 'Total data receive'.

groupByAlertDetails.description: A list of alert details to group by (when matchingMethod is Selected)

groupByCustomDetails.description: A list of custom details keys to group by (when matchingMethod is Selected). Only keys defined in the current alert rule may be used.

groupByEntities.description: A list of entity types to group by (when matchingMethod is Selected). Only entities defined in the current alert rule may be used.

lookbackDuration.description: Limit the group to alerts created within the lookback duration (in ISO 8601 duration format)

matchingMethod.description: Grouping matching method. When method is Selected at least one of groupByEntities, groupByAlertDetails, groupByCustomDetails must be provided and not empty.

createIncident.description: Create incidents from alerts triggered by this analytics rule

groupingConfiguration.description: Set how the alerts that are triggered by this analytics rule, are grouped into incidents

assignedTo.description: The name of the user the incident is assigned to.

email.description: The email of the user the incident is assigned to.

objectId.description: The object id of the user the incident is assigned to.

ownerType.description: The type of the owner the incident is assigned to.

userPrincipalName.description: The user principal name of the user the incident is assigned to.

classification.description: The reason the incident was closed

classificationComment.description: Describes the reason the incident was closed

classificationReason.description: The classification reason the incident was closed with

firstActivityTimeUtc.description: The time of the first activity in the incident

labels.description: List of labels relevant to this incident

lastActivityTimeUtc.description: The time of the last activity in the incident

owner.description: Describes a user that the incident is assigned to

classification.description: The reason the incident was closed

classificationComment.description: Describes the reason the incident was closed.

classificationReason.description: The classification reason the incident was closed with

labels.description: List of labels to add to the incident.

owner.description: Information on the user an incident is assigned to

createdBy.description: Information on the client (user or application) that made some action

lastModifiedBy.description: Information on the client (user or application) that made some action

description.description: Gets or sets the instruction step description.

innerSteps.description:
Gets or sets the inner instruction steps details.
For Example: instruction step 1 might contain inner instruction steps: [instruction step 1.1, instruction step 1.2].

instructions.description: Gets or sets the instruction step details.

title.description: Gets or sets the instruction step title.

parameters.description: Gets or sets the instruction type parameters settings.

type.description: Gets or sets the instruction type name.

headers.description: The custom headers we want to add once we send request to token endpoint.

isCredentialsInHeaders.description: Flag indicating whether we want to send the user name and password to token endpoint in the headers.

isJsonRequest.description: Flag indicating whether the body request is JSON (header Content-Type = application/json), meaning its a Form URL encoded request (header Content-Type = application/x-www-form-urlencoded).

queryParameters.description: The custom query parameter we want to add once we send request to token endpoint.

userName.description: The user name. If user name and password sent in header request we only need to populate the `value` property with the user name (Same as basic auth). If user name and password sent in body request we need to specify the `Key` and `Value`.

properties.description: MCAS (Microsoft Cloud App Security) data connector properties.

dataTypes.description: The available data types for the connector.

tenantId.description: The tenant id to connect to, and get the data from.

properties.description: MDATP (Microsoft Defender Advanced Threat Protection) data connector properties.

dataTypes.description: The available data types for the connector.

tenantId.description: The tenant id to connect to, and get the data from.

name.description: Name of the author. Company or person.

domains.description: domain for the solution content item

verticals.description: Industry verticals for the solution content item

author.description: The creator of the content item.

categories.description: Categories for the solution content item

contentId.description: Static ID for the content.  Used to identify dependencies and content from solutions or community.  Hard-coded/static for out of the box content and solutions. Dynamic for user-created.  This is the resource name

contentSchemaVersion.description: Schema version of the content. Can be used to distinguish between different flow based on the schema version

customVersion.description: The custom version of the content. A optional free text

dependencies.description: Dependencies for the content item, what other content items it requires to work.  Can describe more complex dependencies using a recursive/nested structure. For a single dependency an id/kind/version can be supplied or operator/criteria for complex formats.

firstPublishDate.description: first publish date solution content item

icon.description: the icon identifier. this id can later be fetched from the solution template

kind.description: The kind of content the metadata is for.

lastPublishDate.description: last publish date for the solution content item

parentId.description: Full parent resource ID of the content item the metadata is for.  This is the full resource ID including the scope (subscription and resource group)

previewImages.description: preview image file names. These will be taken from the solution artifacts

previewImagesDark.description: preview image file names. These will be taken from the solution artifacts. used for dark theme support

providers.description: Providers for the solution content item

source.description: Source of the content.  This is where/how it was created.

support.description: Support information for the metadata - type, name, contact information

threatAnalysisTechniques.description: the techniques the resource covers, these have to be aligned with the tactics being used

version.description: Version of the content.  Default and recommended format is numeric (e.g. 1, 1.0, 1.0.0, 1.0.0.0), following ARM template best practices.  Can also be any string, but then we cannot guarantee any version checks

name.description: Name of the content source.  The repo name, solution name, LA workspace name etc.

sourceId.description: ID of the content source.  The solution ID, workspace ID, etc

link.description: Link for support help, like to support page to open a ticket etc.

name.description: Name of the support contact. Company or person.

tier.description: Type of support for content item

properties.description: MicrosoftSecurityIncidentCreation rule properties

alertRuleTemplateName.description: The Name of the alert rule template used to create this rule.

description.description: The description of the alert rule.

displayName.description: The display name for alerts created by this alert rule.

displayNamesExcludeFilter.description: the alerts' displayNames on which the cases will not be generated

displayNamesFilter.description: the alerts' displayNames on which the cases will be generated

enabled.description: Determines whether this alert rule is enabled or disabled.

productFilter.description: The alerts' productName on which the cases will be generated

severitiesFilter.description: the alerts' severities on which the cases will be generated

properties.description: Microsoft Threat Intelligence data connector properties.

microsoftEmergingThreatFeed.description: Data type for Microsoft Threat Intelligence data connector.

lookbackPeriod.description: The lookback period for the feed to be imported. The date-time to begin importing the feed from, for example: 2024-01-01T00:00:00.000Z.

state.description: Describe whether this data type connection is enabled or not.

dataTypes.description: The available data types for the connector.

tenantId.description: The tenant id to connect to, and get the data from.

clientId.description: The Application (client) ID that the OAuth provider assigned to your app.

clientSecret.description: The Application (client) secret that the OAuth provider assigned to your app.

grantType.description: The grant type, usually will be 'authorization code'.

isCredentialsInHeaders.description: Indicating whether we want to send the clientId and clientSecret to token endpoint in the headers.

isJwtBearerFlow.description: A value indicating whether it's a JWT flow.

redirectUri.description: The Application redirect url that the user config in the OAuth provider.

scope.description: The Application (client) Scope that the OAuth provider assigned to your app.

tokenEndpoint.description: The token endpoint. Defines the OAuth2 refresh token.

properties.description: Office data connector properties.

state.description: Describe whether this data type connection is enabled or not.
Describe whether this data type connection is enabled or not.
Describe whether this data type connection is enabled or not.

dataTypes.description: The available data types for the connector.

tenantId.description: The tenant id to connect to, and get the data from.

contentId.description: The content id of the package

contentProductId.description: Unique ID for the content. It should be generated based on the contentId, contentKind and the contentVersion of the package

contentSchemaVersion.description: The version of the content schema.

dependencies.description: The support tier of the package

displayName.description: The display name of the package

icon.description: the icon identifier. this id can later be fetched from the content metadata

isDeprecated.description: Flag indicates if this template is deprecated

isFeatured.description: Flag indicates if this package is among the featured list.

isNew.description: Flag indicates if this is a newly published package.

isPreview.description: Flag indicates if this package is in preview.

lastPublishDate.description: last publish date for the package item

publisherDisplayName.description: The publisher display name of the package

support.description: The support tier of the package

threatAnalysisTechniques.description: the techniques the resource covers, these have to be aligned with the tactics being used

version.description: the latest version number of the package

logicAppResourceId.description: The resource id of the playbook resource.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the playbook resource.

connector.description: Data type for Premium Microsoft Defender for Threat Intelligence data connector.

state.description: Describe whether this data type connection is enabled or not.

dataTypes.description: The available data types for the connector.

lookbackPeriod.description: The lookback period for the feed to be imported. The date-time to begin importing the feed from, for example: 2024-01-01T00:00:00.000Z.

requiredSKUsPresent.description: The flag to indicate whether the tenant has the premium SKU required to access this connector.

tenantId.description: The tenant id to connect to, and get the data from.

properties.description: Premium Microsoft Defender for Threat Intelligence data connector properties.

conditionProperties.description: Describes an automation rule condition on array properties.

relatedResourceId.description: The resource ID of the related resource

installationId.description: Application installation ID. Required when `kind` is `App`. Supported by `GitHub` only.

kind.description: The kind of repository access credentials

token.description: Personal Access Token. Required when `kind` is `PAT`

webhook.description: The webhook object created for the source-control.

action.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the permission is custom actions (POST).

delete.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the permission is delete action (DELETE).

read.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the permission is read action (GET).

write.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the permission is write action (PUT or PATCH).

properties.description: Rest Api Poller data connector properties.

addOnAttributes.description: The add on attributes. The key name will become attribute name (a column) and the value will become the attribute value in the payload.

connectorDefinitionName.description: The connector definition name (the dataConnectorDefinition resource id).

isActive.description: Indicates whether the connector is active or not.

endTimeAttributeName.description: The query parameter name which the remote server expect to end query. This property goes hand to hand with `startTimeAttributeName`

headers.description: The header for the request for the remote server.

httpMethod.description: The HTTP method, default value GET.

isPostPayloadJson.description: Flag to indicate if HTTP POST payload is in JSON format (vs form-urlencoded).

queryParameters.description: The HTTP query parameters to RESTful API.

queryParametersTemplate.description: the query parameters template. Defines the query parameters template to use when passing query parameters in advanced scenarios.

queryTimeFormat.description: The query time format. A remote server can have a query to pull data from range 'start' to 'end'. This property indicate what is the expected time format the remote server know to parse.

queryTimeIntervalAttributeName.description: The query parameter name which we need to send the server for query logs in time interval. Should be defined with `queryTimeIntervalPrepend` and `queryTimeIntervalDelimiter`

queryTimeIntervalDelimiter.description: The delimiter string between 2 QueryTimeFormat in the query parameter `queryTimeIntervalAttributeName`.

queryTimeIntervalPrepend.description: The string prepend to the value of the query parameter in `queryTimeIntervalAttributeName`.

queryWindowInMin.description: The query window in minutes for the request.

rateLimitQPS.description: The Rate limit queries per second for the request..

startTimeAttributeName.description: The query parameter name which the remote server expect to start query. This property goes hand to hand with `endTimeAttributeName`.

properties.description: Scheduled alert rule properties

alertRuleTemplateName.description: The Name of the alert rule template used to create this rule.

customDetails.description: Dictionary of string key-value pairs of columns to be attached to the alert

description.description: The description of the alert rule.

displayName.description: The display name for alerts created by this alert rule.

enabled.description: Determines whether this alert rule is enabled or disabled.

entityMappings.description: Array of the entity mappings of the alert rule

incidentConfiguration.description: The settings of the incidents that created from alerts triggered by this analytics rule

query.description: The query that creates alerts for this rule.

queryFrequency.description: The frequency (in ISO 8601 duration format) for this alert rule to run.

queryPeriod.description: The period (in ISO 8601 duration format) that this alert rule looks at.

severity.description: The severity for alerts created by this alert rule.

suppressionDuration.description: The suppression (in ISO 8601 duration format) to wait since last time this alert rule been triggered.

suppressionEnabled.description: Determines whether the suppression for this alert rule is enabled or disabled.

tactics.description: The tactics of the alert rule

techniques.description: The techniques of the alert rule

templateVersion.description: The version of the alert rule template used to create this rule - in format <a.b.c>, where all are numbers, for example 0 <1.0.2>

triggerOperator.description: The operation against the threshold that triggers alert rule.

triggerThreshold.description: The threshold triggers this alert rule.

connectorId.description: The connector id that provides the following data types

dataTypes.description: The data types used by the security ml analytics settings

customerManagedKey.description: Flag that indicates the status of the CMK setting

credentialsExpireOn.description: Expiration time of service principal credentials.

headers.description: HTTP request headers to session service endpoint.

isPostPayloadJson.description: Indicating whether API key is set in HTTP POST payload.

queryParameters.description: Query parameters to session service endpoint.

sessionIdName.description: Session id attribute name from HTTP response header.

sessionLoginRequestUri.description: HTTP request URL to session service endpoint.

userName.description: The user name attribute key value.

contentTypes.description: Array of source control content types.

description.description: A description of the source control

displayName.description: The display name of the source control

repositoryAccess.description: Repository access credentials. This is write-only object and it never returns back to a user.

repositoryResourceInfo.description: Information regarding the resources created in user's repository.

repoType.description: The repository type of the source control

author.description: The creator of the content item.

contentId.description: Static ID for the content.  Used to identify dependencies and content from solutions or community.  Hard-coded/static for out of the box content and solutions. Dynamic for user-created.  This is the resource name

contentKind.description: The kind of content the template is for.

contentProductId.description: Unique ID for the content. It should be generated based on the contentId of the package, contentId of the template, contentKind of the template and the contentVersion of the template

contentSchemaVersion.description: Schema version of the content. Can be used to distinguish between different flow based on the schema version

customVersion.description: The custom version of the content. A optional free text

dependencies.description: Dependencies for the content item, what other content items it requires to work.  Can describe more complex dependencies using a recursive/nested structure. For a single dependency an id/kind/version can be supplied or operator/criteria for complex formats.

displayName.description: The display name of the template

icon.description: the icon identifier. this id can later be fetched from the content metadata

lastPublishDate.description: last publish date for the content item

mainTemplate.description: The JSON of the ARM template to deploy active content. Expandable.

packageId.description: the package Id contains this template

packageKind.description: the packageKind of the package contains this template

packageName.description: the name of the package contains this template

packageVersion.description: Version of the package.  Default and recommended format is numeric (e.g. 1, 1.0, 1.0.0, 1.0.0.0), following ARM metadata best practices.  Can also be any string, but then we cannot guarantee any version checks

previewImages.description: preview image file names. These will be taken from the solution artifacts

previewImagesDark.description: preview image file names. These will be taken from the solution artifacts. used for dark theme support

source.description: Source of the content.  This is where/how it was created.

support.description: Support information for the template - type, name, contact information

threatAnalysisTechniques.description: the techniques the resource covers, these have to be aligned with the tactics being used

version.description: Version of the content.  Default and recommended format is numeric (e.g. 1, 1.0, 1.0.0, 1.0.0.0), following ARM metadata best practices.  Can also be any string, but then we cannot guarantee any version checks

createdByRef.description: Created by reference of threat intelligence entity

description.description: Description of a threat intelligence entity

displayName.description: Display name of a threat intelligence entity

externalId.description: External ID of threat intelligence entity

externalLastUpdatedTimeUtc.description: External last updated time in UTC

indicatorTypes.description: Indicator types of threat intelligence entities

objectMarkingRefs.description: Threat intelligence entity object marking references

pattern.description: Pattern of a threat intelligence entity

patternType.description: Pattern type of a threat intelligence entity

patternVersion.description: Pattern version of a threat intelligence entity

source.description: Source of a threat intelligence entity

properties.description: TI (Threat Intelligence) data connector properties.

state.description: Describe whether this data type connection is enabled or not.

dataTypes.description: The available data types for the connector.

tenantId.description: The tenant id to connect to, and get the data from.

tipLookbackPeriod.description: The lookback period for the feed to be imported.

objectId.description: The object id of the user.

created.description: The time the watchlist item was created

createdBy.description: Describes a user that created the watchlist item

entityMapping.description: key-value pairs for a watchlist item entity mapping

isDeleted.description: A flag that indicates if the watchlist item is deleted or not

itemsKeyValue.description: key-value pairs for a watchlist item

tenantId.description: The tenantId to which the watchlist item belongs to

updated.description: The last time the watchlist item was updated

updatedBy.description: Describes a user that updated the watchlist item

watchlistItemId.description: The id (a Guid) of the watchlist item

watchlistItemType.description: The type of the watchlist item

contentType.description: The content type of the raw content. Example : text/csv or text/tsv

created.description: The time the watchlist was created

createdBy.description: Describes a user that created the watchlist

defaultDuration.description: The default duration of a watchlist (in ISO 8601 duration format)

displayName.description: The display name of the watchlist

isDeleted.description: A flag that indicates if the watchlist is deleted or not

itemsSearchKey.description: The search key is used to optimize query performance when using watchlists for joins with other data. For example, enable a column with IP addresses to be the designated SearchKey field, then use this field as the key field when joining to other event data by IP address.

labels.description: List of labels relevant to this watchlist

numberOfLinesToSkip.description: The number of lines in a csv/tsv content to skip before the header

rawContent.description: The raw content that represents to watchlist items to create. In case of csv/tsv content type, it's the content of the file that will parsed by the endpoint

source.description: The filename of the watchlist, called 'source'

tenantId.description: The tenantId where the watchlist belongs to

updated.description: The last time the watchlist was updated

updatedBy.description: Describes a user that updated the watchlist

uploadStatus.description: The status of the Watchlist upload : New, InProgress or Complete. **Note** : When a Watchlist upload status is InProgress, the Watchlist cannot be deleted

watchlistId.description: The id (a Guid) of the watchlist

rotateWebhookSecret.description: A flag to instruct the backend service to rotate webhook secret.
